title: Great Heathen Army
summary: The  Great Heathen Army (Old English: mycel hæþen here; Danish: Store Hedenske Hær), also known as the Viking Great Army,[1] was a coalition of Scandinavian warriors who invaded England in 865 AD. Since the late 8th century, the Vikings[lower-alpha 1] had been engaging in raids on centres of wealth, such as monasteries. The Great Heathen Army was  much larger and aimed to occupy and conquer the four kingdoms of East Anglia, Northumbria, Mercia and Wessex.
